C

canLoadObject(Car) - Method in class src.CarTransport
checks if a car can be loaded onto the truck by checking: so it is a car so it is not already loaded on the truck so the total capacity of the truck has not been exceeded so the trailer is put down so the car can be loaded so the car is not a truck (because a truck should not be able to load itself)
canLoadObject(T) - Method in class src.Workshop
Checks if it is possible to load a vehicle into the workshop by checking so the capacity is noot exceeded
cantChangeTrailerAngleWhileMoving() - Method in class src.ScaniaTest
controls so the angle of the trailer cannot be changed when the truck is moving

cantLoadOverCapacity() - Method in class src.WorkshopTest
using a workshop with capacity 1, checks if a 2nd car can be loaded.

cantMoveWithTrailerDown() - Method in class src.ScaniaTest
controls so the truck does not move when the trailer is set down

Superclass Car, keeps track of a car's direction, position and speed Contains the functions of all cars, but some are overridden in sublcasses

CarTransport - Class in src
CarTransport for cars, implements interface CanLoad, Movable, HasTrailer and HasEngine
CarTransport(int) - Constructor for class src.CarTransport
CarTransport initialises a truck (hasATruck) of the kind Scania defines the load capacity of the truck sets the pickup range to 20 pixels initialises an arraylist with the capacity of the total amount of cars possible to load
